data.name: BOND_CREATE_HA_ENABLED
data.value:
Can’t create this bond while HA is enabled
A management interface exists on one of the selected NICs. Moving the management interface to the bond could result in HA network heartbeat failure, so this action is not allowed while HA is on.
To continue, either select different NICs for the bond, or disable HA, create the bond, and then enable HA again.

data.name: BOND_CREATE_WILL_DISTURB_BOTH
data.value:
This bond cannot be created because both management and secondary interfaces exist on your selected bond members.
Both types of interface cannot be added to the same bond. Choose different bond members, or move the management interfaces before creating the bond.

data.name: BOND_CREATE_WILL_DISTURB_PRIMARY
data.value:
Creating this bond will automatically move the management interface on one of your selected bond members to the bond itself:
- [XenCenter] connections to the pool will temporarily be disturbed
- If your network configuration is incorrect then [XenCenter] may permanently lose the connection to the pool, or pool members may be unable to contact each other.

data.name: BOND_CREATE_WILL_DISTURB_SECONDARY
data.value: Creating this bond will disrupt traffic through the secondary interfaces on the bond members while the interfaces are moved onto the bond itself.

data.name: BOND_DELETE_HA_ENABLED
data.value:
Can’t delete this bond while HA is enabled
A management interface exists on one of the bonded NICs. Deleting the bond could result in HA network heartbeat failure, so this action is not allowed while HA is on.
To continue, disable HA, delete the bond, and then enable HA again.

data.name: BOND_DELETE_WILL_DISTURB_BOTH
data.value:
{0}
Deleting this bond will automatically transfer the management and secondary interfaces on the bond to the first slave member of the bond:
- [XenCenter] connections to the pool will temporarily be disturbed
- Traffic through the secondary interface will be disrupted
- If your network configuration is incorrect then [XenCenter] may permanently lose the connection to the pool, or pool members may be unable to contact each other.

data.name: BOND_DELETE_WILL_DISTURB_PRIMARY
data.value:
{0}

data.name: NEWSR_CIFS_BLURB
data.value:
SMB servers are a common form of Windows shared filesystem infrastructure, and can be used as a storage repository substrate for virtual disks.
As SMB storage repositories are shared, the virtual disks stored in them allow VMs to be started on any server in a resource pool and to be migrated between them using Live Migration.
When you configure a SMB storage repository, you simply provide the hostname or IP address of the SMB server, the username, the password and the path to a directory that will be used to contain the storage repository. The SMB server must be configured to export the specified path to all servers in the pool.

data.name: NEWSR_CIFS_ISO_BLURB
data.value: Select this option if you have a library of VM installation ISO images available as a Windows (SMB/CIFS) share that you wish to attach to your host or pool.

data.value: StorageLink technology is used to connect to any of the leading storage architectures and protocols, including DAS, NAS, SAN, iSCSI and Fibre Channel.

data.value: Select the storage system for your storage repository

data.name: NEWSR_CSLG_SETTINGS_PAGE_TITLE
data.value: Select the storage repository settings for use with the provisioning of new storage volumes

data.name: NEWSR_EQUAL_LOGIC_BLURB
data.value: Dell EqualLogic is a scalable form of high performance network attached storage, which supports the addition of capacity without downtime. You can use Dell EqualLogic shared storage to support [XenServer] features such as Live Migration and High Availability.

data.name: NEWSR_EQUAL_LOGIC_FILER_PAGE_TITLE

data.name: NEWSR_LVMOFCOE_BLURB
data.value:
[XenServer] hosts support Software based Fibre Channel over Ethernet using supported Converged Network Adapters (CNAs) which support FCoE in this way.
All configuration required to expose a LUN to the host must be completed manually, including configuring your FCoE fabric, and allocating LUN(s) to your CNA’s public world wide name (PWWN).
Once this configuration has been carried out, this wizard will walk you through discovering and mounting a LUN available to the hosts CNA’s as a SCSI device. The SCSI device can then be used to access the LUN as if it were a locally attached SCSI device.

data.name: NEWSR_LVMOHBA_BLURB
data.value:
[XenServer] hosts support Fibre Channel (FC), Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) and shared Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) storage area networks (SANs) using host bus adapters (HBAs).
All configuration required to expose a LUN to the host must be completed manually, including storage devices, network devices, and the HBA within the [XenServer] host.
Once all configuration is complete the HBA will expose a SCSI device backed by the LUN to the host. The SCSI device can then be used to access the LUN as if it were a locally attached SCSI device.

data.name: NEWSR_LVMOHBA_SUMMARY_MULTIPLE_TITLE
data.value: Summary of new Storage Repositories creation

data.name: NEWSR_LVMOHBA_SUMMARY_SINGLE_TITLE
data.value: Summary of new Storage Repository creation

data.name: NEWSR_LVMOISCSI_BLURB
data.value:
iSCSI or Fibre Channel access to a shared LUN can be configured using LVM.
Using an LVM for a shared SR provides the same performance benefits as a unshared LVM for local disk storage but also enables VM agility.

data.name: NEWSR_MULTI_POOL_WARNING
NEWSR_NAMEPAGE_TITLE
data.value: What do you want to call this Storage Repository?

data.name: NEWSR_NETAPP_BLURB
data.value:
If you have access to a Network Appliance (NetApp) filer with sufficient disk space, running a version of Data ONTAP 7G (version 7.2 or greater), you can configure a custom NetApp Storage Repository.
The driver uses the ZAPI interface to the filer to create a group of FlexVols which correspond to an SR. VDIs are created as virtual LUNs on the filer, and attached to the host using an iSCSI data path.
VM cloning uses the snapshot and clone capabilities of the filer to provide high performance and to ensure compatibility with existing ONTAP filer management tools.

data.name: NEWSR_VHDONFS_BLURB
data.value:
NFS servers are a common form of shared filesystem infrastructure, and can be used as a storage repository substrate for virtual disks.
As NFS storage repositories are shared, the virtual disks stored in them allow VMs to be started on any server in a resource pool and to be migrated between them using Live Migration.
When you configure an NFS storage repository, you simply provide the hostname or IP address of the NFS server and the path to a directory that will be used to contain the storage repository. The NFS server must be configured to export the specified path to all servers in the pool.

data.name: NOT_SAFE_TO_UPGRADE_DEFAULT_WARNING_LONG
data.value:
VMs on local disk will prevent disk repartitioning.
A new disk partitioning scheme is available in [XenServer] [BRANDING_VERSION_7_0] that includes larger dom0 and backup partitions, and dedicated partitions for logging, swap and UEFI.
However, there are VMs on local storage, so the current partitioning scheme will be retained. To benefit from repartitioning on upgrade to [XenServer] [BRANDING_VERSION_7_0], VMs must be moved from local storage first.

data.name: NOT_SAFE_TO_UPGRADE_DEFAULT_WARNING_SHORT
data.value: {0}: VMs on local disk will prevent disk repartitioning.

data.name: NOT_SAFE_TO_UPGRADE_NOT_ENOUGH_SPACE_LONG
data.value:
The disk size of the local storage prevents repartitioning.
A new disk partitioning scheme is available in [XenServer] [BRANDING_VERSION_7_0] that includes larger dom0 and backup partitions, and dedicated partitions for logging, swap and UEFI.

data.value:
To install the [XenServer] upgrade on {0}, follow these steps:
1. Insert the [XenServer] installation CD-ROM in the server’s CD/DVD drive or set up a PXE network boot. 2. Click the Reboot Now button below to reboot the server and begin the installation. 3. Go to the server’s console and follow the on-screen instructions to install the upgrade.
To skip this server and continue to the next server in the pool, click Skip This Server. Note that running a pool with servers on different versions of [XenServer] is not supported, and so any servers that are not upgraded during this rolling pool upgrade should be upgraded as soon as possible afterwards.
The master must be upgraded first, so if you skip the master, the rolling pool upgrade will be canceled for this pool.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_AD
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Active Directory. Active Directory allows you to configure [XenServer] access control by adding named user accounts.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_AD_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Active Directory feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_ALERTS
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Alerting and Reporting capabilities. Email based performance and error alerting will proactively notify administrators of error conditions or performance problems before they affect critical services.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_ALERTS_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Alerting and Reporting feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_CPM
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable VM live migration. This feature enables you to migrate running VMs on shared or local storage between servers in the same pool or across pools with no VM downtime.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_CPM_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Cross-Pool Migration feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_CPUMASKING
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Heterogeneous Pools. Heterogeneous Pools allows hosts with different CPUs to form a resource pool, and allows virtual machines to migrate between them.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_CPUMASKING_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Heterogeneous Pools feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_DMC
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Dynamic Memory Control. Dynamic Memory Control allows [XenServer] to adjust the memory of live virtual machines, and respond dynamically to changing demands on the host server.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_DMC_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Dynamic Memory Control feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_DR
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Disaster Recovery. The Disaster Recovery feature allows you to recover your critical VMs and vApps at your DR site in the event of a disaster at your primary production site.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_DR_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Disaster Recovery feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_ENHANCEDSR
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable StorageLink™ Technology. StorageLink allows [XenServer] to leverage all the power of your existing storage hardware and offload storage operations automatically. This allows for high performance and space efficient storage provisioning, cloning, and snapshot capabilities to be handled in hardware using your storage hardware's native features.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_GPU
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable GPU pass-through. The GPU pass-through feature allows you to assign a dedicated graphics processing unit to a VM for higher graphics performance.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_GPU_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] GPU pass-through feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_HA
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable High Availability. High Availability allows virtual machines to be automatically restarted in the event of an underlying hardware failure or individual VM failure. If the server fails the VMs will be intelligently restarted on other virtualized servers in the resource pool.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_HA_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] High Availability feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_PERFORMANCE
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Performance Reporting capabilities. Performance Reporting provides guidance on overall environment performance trends and enables you to accurately plan capacity as business needs change.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_PERFORMANCE_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Performance Reporting capabilities feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_RBAC
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Role Based Access Control. Using the RBAC feature, you will be able to control access to vital components in your [XenServer] resource pools, with full audit logging capabilities and seamless integration with your current Active Directory setup.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_RBAC_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Role Based Access Control feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_VM_APPLIANCES
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable vApps. The vApps feature allows you to place your VMs into groups, allowing them to be started or stopped as a unit, and also allowing them to be easily recovered at your DR site in the event of a disaster at your primary production site.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_VM_APPLIANCES_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the vApps feature of [XenServer] or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_VM_PROTECTION
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable VM Protection and Recovery. VM Protection and Recovery allows you to protect your critical VMs by scheduling automatic snapshots, and optionally, archiving those snapshots to a CIFS or NFS share.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_VM_PROTECTION_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] VM Protection and Recovery feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_WLB
data.value: Upgrade your [XenServer] license to enable Dynamic Workload Balancing. Dynamic Workload Balancing continually profiles your virtual machines’ and [XenServer] hosts’ performance and will intelligently rebalance and optimally place new workloads to ensure the best use of physical server resources in your resource pool.

data.name: UPSELL_BLURB_WLB_MORE
data.value: To learn more about the [XenServer] Dynamic Workload Balancing feature or to start a [XenServer] trial, click the button below.
